alert.note: Alert for Banks; Forsyth; Hall; Jackson; White (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:53PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Forsyth, Banks, southeastern White, Hall and northeastern Jackson Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1053 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Gainesville to Gillsville to Banks Crossing, and moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Commerce, Cleveland, Homer, Oakwood, Lula, Maysville, Clermont, Gillsville, Pinefield Crossroads, Mossy Creek, Leaf, Hollingsworth, Banks Crossing and Oscarville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
